name.en-us: O*NET Content Model Worker Requirements - Cross-Functional Skills: U.S. Department of Labor (DOL)

description.en-us: Developed capacities that facilitate performance of activities that occur across jobs

competencyText.en-us: Developed capacities used to work with people to achieve goals

en-us: Social

competencyText.en-us: Developed capacities used to solve novel, ill-defined problems in complex, real-world settings

en-us: Problem Solving

competencyText.en-us: Developed capacities used to design, set-up, operate, and correct malfunctions involving application of machines or technological systems

en-us: Technical

competencyText.en-us: Developed capacities used to understand, monitor, and improve socio-technical systems

en-us: People and Technology Systems

competencyText.en-us: Developed capacities used to allocate resources efficiently

en-us: Resource Management

competencyText.en-us: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

en-us: understanding people's reactions

competencyText.en-us: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

en-us: changing what is done based on other people's actions

competencyText.en-us: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

en-us: talking people into changing their minds or their behavior

competencyText.en-us: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

en-us: bringing people together to solve differences

competencyText.en-us: Teaching others how to do something.

en-us: teaching people how to do something

competencyText.en-us: Actively looking for ways to help people.

en-us: looking for ways to help people

competencyText.en-us: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

en-us: noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it

competencyText.en-us: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

en-us: figuring out what a product or service needs to be able to do

competencyText.en-us: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

en-us: making equipment and technology useful for customers

competencyText.en-us: Determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

en-us: deciding what kind of tools and equipment are needed to do a job

competencyText.en-us: Installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

en-us: installing equipment, machines, wiring, or computer programs

competencyText.en-us: Writing computer programs for various purposes.

en-us: writing computer programs

competencyText.en-us: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

en-us: watching gauges, dials, or display screens to make sure a machine is working

competencyText.en-us: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

en-us: using equipment or systems

competencyText.en-us: Performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

en-us: planning and doing the basic maintenance on equipment

competencyText.en-us: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

en-us: figuring out what is causing equipment, machines, wiring, or computer programs to not work

competencyText.en-us: Repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

en-us: repairing machines or systems using the right tools

competencyText.en-us: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

en-us: testing how well a product or service works

competencyText.en-us: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

en-us: thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one

competencyText.en-us: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

en-us: figuring out how a system should work and how changes in the future will affect it

competencyText.en-us: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

en-us: measuring how well a system is working and how to improve it

competencyText.en-us: Managing one's own time and the time of others.

en-us: managing your time and the time of other people

competencyText.en-us: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

en-us: making spending decisions and keeping track of what is spent

competencyText.en-us: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

en-us: managing equipment and materials

competencyText.en-us: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.

en-us: selecting and managing the best workers for a job
